text:

text: Are those actually a thing?

text:
Australians call both chips.

TBH it is pretty inconvenient

Australians call both chips.

text: I wish America realized the crap other countries go through by screwing up convention for things. Like why can't I just use the metric system? Poor australians getting potato chips instead of fries...

elements.text: I wish America realized the crap other countries go through by screwing up convention for things. Like why can't I just use the metric system? Poor australians getting potato chips instead of fries...

text: Americans aren't actually debating this :laughing:

elements.text: Americans aren't actually debating this

text:
the worst is in Canada a burger and chips (as the thin flat cruchy ones) is actual food you can buy at pubs.
And it is just really disappointing when you were expecting fries.

elements.text:
the worst is in Canada a burger and chips (as the thin flat cruchy ones) is actual food you can buy at pubs.
And it is just really disappointing when you were expecting fries.

text: Nice pubs will thin slice the potatoes and deep fry the chips for you, diners or whatever will sometimes just give you the packaged snack food alternative, I've had this happen maybe twice in my life, diners are a much more common example, I remember clearly getting snack chips at Alice's Resturant in California with a tuna melt and a pickle

elements.text: Nice pubs will thin slice the potatoes and deep fry the chips for you, diners or whatever will sometimes just give you the packaged snack food alternative, I've had this happen maybe twice in my life, diners are a much more common example, I remember clearly getting snack chips at Alice's Resturant in California with a tuna melt and a pickle

text: The bigger conspiracy against moose loving Canucks is "Canadian Bacon" (i.e. sliced ham), *nobody* calls sliced ham bacon

elements.text: The bigger conspiracy against moose loving Canucks is "Canadian Bacon" (i.e. sliced ham),
nobody
calls sliced ham bacon

text: Hey Canada has the best maple syrup I'll let them off the hook.

elements.text: Hey Canada has the best maple syrup I'll let them off the hook.

text: ah you mean "sweet golden tree elixir" that's what Canadians actually call maple syrup

elements.text: ah you mean "sweet golden tree elixir" that's what Canadians actually call maple syrup

text:
that stuff is priceless man, people do desperate things for it:
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Canadian_Maple_Syrup_Heist>

elements.text: that stuff is priceless man, people do desperate things for it:

text: that keeps happening people have been successfully hijacking food trucks recently

elements.text: that keeps happening people have been successfully hijacking food trucks recently

text: Thats bizarre... Like what do you do with millions of gallons of maple syrup lol

elements.text: Thats bizarre... Like what do you do with millions of gallons of maple syrup lol

text: you mean sweet golden tree elixir? people would give their lives for it, it's part of the oath you take to become Canadian, "I swear to give my life so others may enjoy the sweet golden tree elixir", no oath, no Canuck badge for you

text: think of it like Canada is the planet Dune and spice is maple syrup

elements.text: think of it like Canada is the planet Dune and spice is maple syrup

text: He who controls spice, controls the universe.

elements.text: He who controls spice, controls the universe.

text: Canadian bacon seems just like Australian bacon. And it sucks that I can't get it in the UK

elements.text: Canadian bacon seems just like Australian bacon. And it sucks that I can't get it in the UK

text: It's pretty good tbh. It's like not super greesey fatty, and tastes bacony but hammy

elements.text: It's pretty good tbh. It's like not super greesey fatty, and tastes bacony but hammy

text:
I was so confused when people said you couldn't eat bacon raw.
Like it's not good raw, but it's perfectly safe.

elements.text:
I was so confused when people said you couldn't eat bacon raw.
Like it's not good raw, but it's perfectly safe.

text: I think theoretically it is safe, especially if its like real bacon, but I don't think I could handle that. I go through phases of being vegetarian to eating meat and that'd creep me out personally.

elements.text: I think theoretically it is safe, especially if its like real bacon, but I don't think I could handle that. I go through phases of being vegetarian to eating meat and that'd creep me out personally.

text: Raw minced pork is delicious too but a lot of people say they can't imagine it's safe to eat

elements.text: Raw minced pork is delicious too but a lot of people say they can't imagine it's safe to eat

text: pretty sure raw pork has a tendancy to carry parasites or something like that. I think bacon is only safe because it's been salted and smoked or something
